2.text: How long will you vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

3.text: These ten times have you reproached me: you are not ashamed that you make yourselves strange to me.

4.text: And be it indeed that I have erred, my error remains with myself.

5.text: If indeed you will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:

6.text: Know now that God has overthrown me, and has compassed me with his net.

7.text: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.

8.text: He has fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he has set darkness in my paths.

9.text: He has stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

10.text: He has destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and my hope has he removed like a tree.

11.text: He has also kindled his wrath against me, and he counts me to him as one of his enemies.

12.text: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

13.text: He has put my brothers far from me, and my acquaintance are truly estranged from me.

14.text: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

15.text: They that dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

16.text: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I entreated him with my mouth.

17.text: My breath is strange to my wife, though I entreated for the childrenâ€™s sake of my own body.

18.text: Yes, young children despised me; I arose, and they spoke against me.

19.text: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

20.text: My bone sticks to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

21.text: Have pity on me, have pity on me, O you my friends; for the hand of God has touched me.

22.text: Why do you persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

23.text: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

24.text: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

25.text: For I know that my redeemer lives, and that he shall stand at the latter day on the earth:

26.text: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:

27.text: Whom I shall see for myself, and my eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.

28.text: But you should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

29.text: Be you afraid of the sword: for wrath brings the punishments of the sword, that you may know there is a judgment.
